str2: And, even, also, namely.
A king, ruler, but in some passages clearly to be translated: emperor. Probably from basis; a sovereign.
Compound of heros and eidos; heroic; Herod, the name of four Jewish kings.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Name, character, fame, reputation. From a presumed derivative of the base of ginosko; a 'name'.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
Apparent, clear, visible, manifest; adv: clearly. From phaino; shining, i.e. Apparent; neuter publicly, externally.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
Of Hebrew origin; Joannes, the name of four Israelites.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Lit: I dip, submerge, but specifically of ceremonial dipping; I baptize.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I wake, arouse, (b) I raise up. Probably akin to the base of agora; to waken, i.e. Rouse.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
(a) adj: dead, lifeless, subject to death, mortal, (b) noun: a dead body, a corpse. From an apparently primary nekus; dead.
This; he, she, it.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
From dunamai; force; specially, miraculous power.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From energes; to be active, efficient.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
